s.text: Charles was enthusiastically received when he landed in Catalonia, but Philip, supported by France, won the war and became the first Bourbon ruler as Philip V. After a 13-month siege, on 11 September 1714, the royal army captured and sacked Barcelona.
The following year, Catalonia won a charter establishing home rule, restoration of the regional parliament and flag, and recognition of Catalan as the official language of the region.
The ensuing years were rife with constant wars, shifting alliances, and disputes over succession to the crown.
